channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Fly tipped sofa on Linley Rd

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linley Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pigeon nest above pavement causing excessive excrement - public health hazard, 1st February
item.description:
Hi there - There is a pigeon nest located in a broken shop front at this location on Cadiz Street. This causes excessive amounts of excrement on the pavement, which is made worse when it rains. The other evening after it had been raining I saw an elderly person (with poor sight or maybe drunk?) slip on it. He somehow managed to avoid falling flat on the pavement. This old shopfront is very unsightly and attracts fly tippers. I'm concerned that it now poses a public health risk that could lead to someone getting sick and/or injury by falling over. There could be legal action taken against the council (if you are responsible for maintaining safe pavements). Please can the shop owner be contacted to repair the shop front and remove the pigeon nest? Many thanks for the consideration.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cadiz Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Broken and blocked drain, 1st February
item.description:
I went to grab things out my boot of the car and thankfully able to save myself by having Chucky boots on as if not I’d of ended up putting my foot down the drain where the grate has broken maybe even causing damage to my foot. This does need fixing so nobody causes themselves damage via this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footbury Hill Road, Goddington, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Constant Rubbish outside Delaney House, 1st February
item.description:
There is constantly rubbish being fly tipped outside Delaney House. Recently someone moved into a flat within the block and emptied the contents here - mattresses, furniture, the works. Vans pull in in the night and drop off stuff. Is there anything that can be done to prevent this? It is a shame for the people that live here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thames Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 abandoned caravans on Eade Rd, n4, 1st February
item.description:
See pic. 1st caravan was parked for several months on the other side of barrier on Eade Rd, just past barrier at the Linkway. It moved for a week and is now where the picture has been taken and now back for at least a month. It was reported at least twice before and no action taken. Traffic warden on scooter said they can’t give it a ticket. 2nd caravan appeared this week. Both need to be removed as clearly the first has attracted attention/ word gotren around that the council don’t take action. This is v frustrating.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Eade Road, Harringay, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin and fly tipping, 1st February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, Greater London
